definition: to feel/to move/to touch/to affect/feeling/emotion/(suffix) sense of ~
nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]

pinyin: fen1 lie4 qing2 gan3 xing4 zhang4 ai4

definition: Sense and Sensibility, novel by Jane Austen 珍·奧斯汀|珍·奥斯汀[Zhen1 · Ao4 si1 ting1]

sentences.english: While she could be strict, she could also be a real “softie.
sentences.chinese: 她既有嚴厲的一面，同時也真的是一個感性的人。

sentences.english: Sixth, citation studies are highly field-sensitive.
sentences.chinese: 第六，引用研究對領域具有高度敏感性。

sentences.english: The perceptual shape of the light appearing elusively in the dark, a unique charm of optic artistry.
sentences.chinese: 黑夜裏若隱若現的感性造型，獨具光影藝術魅力。

sentences.english: Best body wash I've been able to find for my sensitive skin.
sentences.chinese: 我是敏感性皮膚，這是我用過的最好的沐浴乳。

sentences.english: Music lessons and practice during childhood increase the sensitivity of the brain stem to the sounds of human speech.
sentences.chinese: 兒童時期的音樂課和練習會增加腦幹對人聲的敏感性。

sentences.english: The anaerobe resistance fungus medicine has the stable sensitivity.
sentences.chinese: 厭氧菌對抗菌藥物有較穩定的敏感性。

sentences.english: There have existed a large number of poems with "heart-broken" themes in the middle and late Tang Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 中晚唐詩人具有不同於初唐和盛唐詩人的敏感性。

sentences.english: Population susceptibility to infection by a new virus drives the dynamics of an influenza pandemic.
sentences.chinese: 新病毒的人羣易感性驅動流感大流行。

sentences.english: The chilling sensitivity of stamen, pistil and fertilization of pepper at different stages was studied.
sentences.chinese: 現蕾期和開花期的花器官對低溫的敏感性不同。

sentences.english: Reflective warriors have a tragic sensibility.
sentences.chinese: 會反思的戰士有一種悲劇敏感性。

sentences.english: Sensitivity and rationality, just like life and death, are complicated issues in life.
sentences.chinese: 感性與理性就如同生與死是人生一道難解的命題。

sentences.english: The Universal is therefore in point of fact the truth of sense-certainty, the true content of sense-experience.
sentences.chinese: 因此普遍的東西事實上就是感性確定性的真理性。

sentences.english: And that tends to be the form that most errors in affective forecasting take.
sentences.chinese: 情感性預測研究中的誤差也是這樣產生的。

sentences.english: In an attempt to change this situation, it's quite necessary to alter sports from perceptibility to rationality.
sentences.chinese: 理性體育取代感性體育是改變這一現象的根本舉措。

sentences.english: Another characteristic of the Cancer woman is that she is extremely emotional and sensitive.
sentences.chinese: 巨蟹女的另一個特點是極度的感性和敏感。

sentences.english: Results and conclusion Lowersensitivity and higher specificity were shown in 3P test.
sentences.chinese: 結果和結論3P試驗敏感性較低，但特異性較好。

definition: Sense and Sensibility, novel by Jane Austen 珍·奧斯汀|珍·奥斯汀[Zhen1 · Ao4 si1 ting1]
to act impetuously (idiom); on an impulse
